content: Region in Singapore The **East Region** is one of the five [regions](/wiki/Regions_of_Singapore) in the [city-state](/wiki/City-state) of [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). The region is the 2nd most densely populated among the five, and has the smallest land area. [Bedok](/wiki/Bedok) is the region's most populous town and [Tampines](/wiki/Tampines) is the regional centre of the area. Comprising 11,000 hectares, it includes six [planning areas](/wiki/Planning_Areas_of_Singapore) and is also home to Singapore's [Changi Airport](/wiki/Singapore_Changi_Airport) and [Paya Lebar Air Base](/wiki/Paya_Lebar_Air_Base). The region also houses the [Changi Naval Base](/wiki/Changi_Naval_Base) and [Changi Prison](/wiki/Changi_Prison), which was first constructed in 1936 by the British and is Singapore's oldest internment facility. ## Geography With a total land area of 93.1 km2 (35.9 sq mi), the region is situated on the eastern corner of [Singapore Island](/wiki/Pulau_Ujong), bordering the [North-East Region](/wiki/North-East_Region,_Singapore) to the north-west, [Central Region](/wiki/Central_Region,_Singapore) to the south-west and shares [riverine borders](/wiki/Natural_border) with the [North-Eastern Islands](/wiki/North-Eastern_Islands) to the north. ## Government The East Region is governed locally by two different [Community Development Councils](/wiki/Community_Development_Council), namely the [North East CDC](/wiki/North_East_Community_Development_Council) and the [South East CDC](/wiki/South_East_Community_Development_Council), both divided into six different planning areas. ### Planning Areas Planning AreaArea (km2)PopulationDensity (/km2)[Bedok](/wiki/Bedok)21.69289,75013,360.5[Changi](/wiki/Changi)40.612,53062.3[Changi Bay](/wiki/Changi_Bay)1.700[Pasir Ris](/wiki/Pasir_Ris)15.02139,8909,313[Paya Lebar](/wiki/Paya_Lebar)11.69403.4[Tampines](/wiki/Tampines)20.89261,23012,506.2 ## Economy Manufacturing makes up majority of the economical activity in the region, with industrial estates located in the planning areas of [Bedok](/wiki/Bedok), [Changi](/wiki/Changi), [Pasir Ris](/wiki/Pasir_Ris), [Tampines](/wiki/Tampines) and [Paya Lebar](/wiki/Paya_Lebar). Pasir Ris and Tampines [Wafer Fabrication](/wiki/Wafer_Fabrication) Parks houses several major [semiconductor fabrication companies](/wiki/Semiconductor_fabrication_plant) such as [GlobalFoundries](/wiki/GlobalFoundries), [UMC](/wiki/United_Microelectronics_Corporation), [SSMC](/wiki/Systems_on_Silicon_Manufacturing) and [Siltronic](/wiki/Siltronic). [IBM](/wiki/IBM) had also set up a [S$](/wiki/Singapore_dollar)90 million technology park along Tampines Industrial Avenue, to manufacture its System Z mainframes and high-end POWER systems for its clients across Asia. [Changi](/wiki/Changi) is also a major [aviation](/wiki/Aviation_in_Singapore) and commercial zone in the region with airlines such as, [Singapore Airlines](/wiki/Singapore_Airlines), [Singapore Airlines Cargo](/wiki/Singapore_Airlines_Cargo), [Scoot](/wiki/Scoot), [Valuair](/wiki/Valuair) and [Tigerair](/wiki/Tigerair) having their head offices in the area. [Changi Business Park](/wiki/Changi_Business_Park), located in Changi South, also houses several commercial offices of business such as, [DBS Bank](/wiki/DBS_Bank), [Standard Chartered](/wiki/Standard_Chartered) and [IBM](/wiki/IBM). ## Education Residents living within the area have access to different educational facilities ranging from preschools to primary and secondary schools as these are located around the different towns in the East region. The area is also home to various tertiary institutions such as various [ITEs](/wiki/Institute_of_Technical_Education), [Polyechnics](/wiki/Polytechnic_(Singapore)) and [Junior Colleges](/wiki/Junior_college_(Singapore)), including [ITE College East](/wiki/ITE_College_East), [Singapore University of Technology and Design](/wiki/Singapore_University_of_Technology_and_Design), [Tampines Meridian Junior College](/wiki/Tampines_Meridian_Junior_College), [Temasek Junior College](/wiki/Temasek_Junior_College), [Temasek Polytechnic](/wiki/Temasek_Polytechnic) and [Victoria Junior College](/wiki/Victoria_Junior_College), 6 international schools namely, Global Indian International School (GIIS), East Coast Campus, NPS International School, Sekolah Indonesia Singapura, [Overseas Family School](/wiki/Overseas_Family_School) and [United World College of South East Asia (Tampines Campus)](/wiki/United_World_College_of_South_East_Asia) and a special needs school, Katong School (APSN). - East Region, Singapore travel guide from Wikivoyage This [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) location article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: East Region, Singapore
